name: electricity, high voltage, hydro, import from CA-NF | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20075/documentation

This dataset represents the amount of imported electricity from Newfoundland and Labrador (Canada) to Quebec (Canada). The electricity comes exclusively from hydropower plants.The import value is valid for 2016 and includes all electricity imports, independently whether used within the importing country, or re-exported. For a discussion of different ways of modeling electricity trade in LCI, please refer to (Itten & Frischknecht 2014).

This activity represents the point of 'handing over' the electricity from one country to the other at the border.

This dataset doesn't include any electricity losses or transmission infrastructure as these are accounted for in the market datasets.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description: In 2016 more than 95% of electricity from hydropower in CA-NF was generated in reservoir, non-alpine plants, only a small share by run-of-river plants. It is therefore assumed that this import flow is entirely supplied by plants of the type reservoir, non-alpine.
